author: moongq77
title: Parkinsons home visit
body:
Neuro Review with South Petherton Hospital.  
This is the 4th time over the last 18 months we have had to reschedule my father's Parkinson's home visit, due to staff sickness or other reasons. We finally had this 5th appointment made for this morning. But here we are, still waiting, over an hour later. No call, no contact. This is an elderly couple who are struggling through, trying to get the care they need.  
I've tried to phone the number given on the letter, but it just goes to answer phone. They could give just a courtesy telephone call, just to say they would be late, or explain that they were sick again and couldn't make it today.  
My father has been continuously deteriorating, and this is just so long without any contact or care.

author: AbandonedbytheNHS
title: Uninformed and dismissive
body:
Having been refused a face to face appointment with a GP I requested a copy of my health records to allow me take ownership of my own health care. It took just under 3 months and a threat of official intervention to finally receive these. Staff have been hostile, seemed uninformed and have been dismissive when ANY data protection matters are raised. The GPâ€™s flippant response when I suggested I would take things further was offensive and unprofessional. The member of staff on reception had never heard of SPIRE and the option to opt out of it and informed me they were too busy to deal with that kind of thing and that I should call back.  
Uncaring , unapproachable and unwilling to be helpful sums up my current experiences with GP services in my area Iâ€™m afraid to say.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: handsetpr73
title: Breaking my ankle
body:
I broke my ankle at the start of the summer holidays.  
I was treated at the DGRI in Dumfries, and I was very lucky not to need surgery, just a cast over the summer.  
The staff were all really friendly, in particular the nurses in the orthopaedic outpatient ward, the porters and the xray staff. The younger doctor I saw was also super friendly and had great bedside manner.  
I wanted to pass on a couple of observations though about the environment, travelling between orthopaedics outpatients and the xray department in a wheelchair several times over the course of my treatment.  
Firstly, the porters had to climb past me to push buttons to open the various doors we went through, stopping, starting and apologising each time. This seems really silly in such a new build. I would like to see either supermarket style automatic doors or the buttons in a place suitable for the porters to hit them.  
Secondly, the doors are only barely wide enough for the wheelchairs to go through and while I was in the xray department, I saw doors propped open with a bottle of solution, folded bits of card and in one case a box. The staff don't to this to deliberately break fire regulations, but to cope with an unsuitable environment. So I would like the whole doorway situation to be looked at.  
Finally, the porters cannot see oncoming traffic down the corridor as they leave the bays pushing people. Again, they have to stop, start, lean past you, apologise. I think it could all be so much smoother if you just installed a couple of parabolic mirrors.  
Thanks for listening, I'm very grateful to all the staff who were there for me when I really need them.

author: authenticxr66
title: I think you're just marvelous
body:
The Cardiac nurses at Bideford Hospital gave me a leaflet asking what I thought of the service, and here it is: I think you are just marvelous.  
The care I have is lovely and inspiring. I think the person I deal with, Rebecca, I've seen her a couple of times now, is just lovely. She is so helpful and has given me such good explanations about whats going on with my heart. I am very happy indeed with this care, I've been looked after very well indeed.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: betazx48
title: Wife needs a new contraceptive in arm.
body: Can't book or get an appointment,just keeps getting put off each time she rings.No flexibility,poor customer service.

author: Rascal
title: Colonoscopy
body: From the initial interview to discharge all the members of staff were helpful and made me feel comfortable.   The procedure was carried out without any problems and the results were explained well.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Dee/53
title: Breathing problems
body:
I was admitted to the clinic yesterday and I can't praise the staff highly enough. I was treated with the upmost respect and dignity. The doctor and nurses treated me as a human being and not just a number, which I very much appreciated.  
Thank you all

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Mo64
title: Hysteroscopy and Myosure procedure
body:
Hi, I had been having some blood on toilet paper when wiping after urination, I am 56 and period stopped at 40 (menopause) so was a little worried, went to G.P and was referred to a local hospital for a hysteroscopy, having had a colonoscopy quite a number of years prior I knew a hysteroscopy could also be painful.  
I wasn't sure what to expect, received no pain relief nor was it ever mentioned, There was a female who did the hysteroscopy and 1 nurse who seemed slightly uncomfortable and she was trying to chat to me.  
Never in my entire life have i felt pain like this, I know my knuckles were white from the pain and I was crying, sweating and felt completely violated, it was like a searing, stabbing pain, I would rather go through labour pains any day than ever have this done again without G.A., I am utterly disgusted, so angry that this is actually happening to women every day and it's took me a year for this not to be in my head every day, however I will never forget it and please don't judge me when I say that even if I knew I had a cancer in this area I would never again agree to having a hysteroscopy without a G.A. again, I can't find the words to express how painful, barbaric and violating i felt this procedure was.  
,

author: whiplash
title: Day surgery
body: A truly caring experience at this marvellous unit. From start to finish I was extremely well looked after. Efficient, friendly and top class cleanliness. I would like to especially single out my nurse Kirsty who couldnâ€™t do too much for me and made me feel as if I was the only patient in her care which obviously I was not. Thank you to the her and the whole team.

author: Hhhh
title: Outpatient procedure
body: Well looked after by both liv and jen who spoke to me during my procedure to take my mind off what was happening! Dr kangeyan lovely too. Explained things simply. Thanks ðŸ™‚

author: chaffinch
title: Fantastic care in ward 104 ARI
body:
My care on ward 104 was second to none, all the staff treated me with respect and dignity. I had a long stay on the ward. I was unable to have many visits from my family, however all members of staff were easy to speak to and genuinely cared about what was going on in my life outside the hospital. The ward is a busy ward with lots of patients to look after but the staff will always make time for you, even senior nurses like the charge nurse. When it came to being discharged, many members of staff made the time to pop in to say bye to me after I had spent so much time on the ward!  
The domestic staff (green tunic) will serve teas and coffee and clean the bathrooms, and health care assistants (light blue tunic) will answer any buzzers, make beds & get you washed, and pass messages on to the nurses. Nurses (blue tunic) will do medicine rounds, wound dressings, putting up fluids etc  
Being tube fed, I was under the care of the surgical team, parenteral nutrition team, nutrition nurses and dietitian alongside regular 104 staff and gastroenterologists.  
I will say that I was waiting on a surgical procedure which was due to be preformed on a Wednesday. However, there was miscommunication from the surgical team to the doctors and nursing staff about a delay, so we didnâ€™t hear all day that the procedure actually wasnâ€™t happening. Though this was quickly rectified and subsequently I was taken in on the emergency surgical list the next day.  
I was extremely happy with this result. I would like to say that the hospitals are really trying to balance covid care and other emergency & routine care, which has resulted in a lot of pressure on the services offered, the stress of it all is clear when speaking to staff trying to find beds or when trying to organise a more serious procedure like a surgical one, this resulted in a couple of weeks delay initially while we experienced quite a few complications that could otherwise be surgically solved in a world without the current pressures experienced at the moment. However this isnâ€™t reflective on the staff on the ward at all and alternative treatments were attempted while we were waiting for the surgical team to intervene.  
After my surgery, there were slight complications and I required slightly more care than usual, despite usually being independent, the staff were more than happy to offer help with washing which was much appreciated.  
When considering covid, I felt very safe for most of my time on ward 104, given that the ward is mostly side rooms. Towards the end of my stay I was moved into the four bedded bay, but there is frequent testing for new patients. The ward is constantly being cleaned and your bed space is always being wiped down by the healthcare assistants and domestic staff before teas and mealtimes.  
I felt listened to and that all staff involved in my care were knowledgeable about my condition. This was important to me as Iâ€™ve had poor experiences before where medical staff at another hospital did know much about my condition. I also felt that students were willing to learn and that nurses were willing to teach students new things. I also felt as though I had a say in my treatment & discharge, particularly when it came to managing my nutrition. This was very important to me.  
Discharge was fast and the discharge lounge was comfortable. I would also like to reassure any patients from the northern isles that the discharge nurse Judith is kind and compassionate, and will go above and beyond to ensure you are comfortable during your hospital stay, I would like to extend my thanks to her for all her help over my stay which was much appreciated by both me and my family.  
overall although a stay in hospital is never pleasant, I believe the ward 104 staff work hard to make it as comfortable as possible for you to recover as well as you can.  
Of all the staff who deserve a million thanks in the world, I would like to extend my thanks to dietitian Yvonne, and also to HCA Karen, who took me down to surgery, as well as washed my hair in the week after it. I was especially anxious for the surgery after a few bad experiences and she was really lovely to talk to even if she didnâ€™t realise it!  
Thank you again ward 104 for all your help and for looking after me for all this time!

author: Charles112
title: Repulsed by services in NHS
body:
Mental health services will not help, they write down what I say and send it to me, like a blog that somebody else wrote. If any medication, its never followed up, staff have acted rude, obnoxious and used any abnormal behavior against me, psychosis is real yet they are not equipped to deal with it, they say its no money as an excuse,  
AandE staff are have shown the most depraved attitude apart from a few very nice ones, I feel sorry for some as the others let the side down, I had paramedics ask if I was Gay which was the only thing they said, I put it down to stress yet they started chatting to their mates once in there. PALS were nice yet when cold, I have never been abusive but I guess being mixed race and tattooed there must be discrimination.  
Trying to move area now, hate going out and now have serious PTSD and Misophonia, depression and anxiety. Theres more but it would take a while. 5 friends iv lost due to suicide in this area. False hope is not ok end of! Lastly can't get justice, the poor can't get justice.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

author: Chace34
title: Hotel hospital
body:
Last year, in the first lockdown, my son was admitted to hospital with oedema which we later found to be a symptom of FSGS.  
It was a period of great anxiety for us as a family. Throughout we were incredibly impressed by all the staff who we came in contact with - from our doctors and nurses to the cleaners in our ward.  
Our nurses in particular took time to talk to us, get to know us and make my son's experience at hospital so fun and full of care that he talked about wanting to go into 'hospital hotel' again as soon as we had got out.  
What made this experience all the more impressive was that the staff themselves must have had enormous anxieties relating to going into work during Covid - something I related to as a HSC worker. They were exposing themselves to potential risks but never complained or let their fears show. They made wore full PPE in the stifling heat of the ward and still were able to channel their energy into making medication and observation rounds fun for my son.  
We would like to thank them for making my son's first substantial experience of hospital so happy - it has paved the way for positive regular visits to the hospital and left us in no doubt of the good care we would receive in the future.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: betajg75
title: My experience was second to none
body:
I have no complaints at all, I can only heap praise on the doctors from my surgery and at Barnstable hospital. They are excellent.  
Obviously, if they had more money, more nurses, they could do even better. I'd be all for the government giving them more.  
I can't say anything bad about the care from the North Devon District Hospital.  
I have a little bit of prostate cancer, a bit of a blockage in my leg, a little heart valve issue. Mr Moody was in charge of the team looking after me this time. I couldn't say anything detrimental about any of them. They are all such wonderful people, and very brave.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Carolli4
title: Hospital Consultation
body:
I was sent to Pilgrim by my consultant for research into a gynaecological discomfort.  
I met with the consultant specialist nurse reporting to her consultant. Her questioning was thorough and appropriate. Her advice and help were first class. A most helpful, friendly and informative professional. she talked through all my worries and concerns and agreed to follow up on a couple of points she thought were important. I came away from our meeting feeling listened to, professionally assessed and reassured in all areas. Thank you

author: mthoms12
title: Dad was well taken care of
body:
My father was a patient in Ward 6C at the Queen Elizabeth for a number of days recently. He has asked me to thank the team responsible for his care.  
He would like me to thank Dr Davie for taking the time to talk to him and reassure him that he was on the right track, he would like to thank his nurse Jacob for being someone to talk to about his "interests" (my dad is football mad so that's probably what he means by that!) as well as for treating him with care and compassion and he would also like to thank cleaners George and Joanne for being professional and thorough with their cleaning as he had been worried about coming into hospital during a virus pandemic.  
Everyone of you are a credit to the NHS, including the auxilliary nurse that helped us find a wheelchair and kept my dad company. We cannot remember your name but you are a star. I know it takes dozens of people to provide healthcare and we don't see most of you so I would also like to thank other staff working away in the background.  
One negative was the lifts used to get to the ward and back again, people were piling into them despite signs recommending social distancing. My dad was very scared about this, we hope something can be done to sort this (maybe signs advising of a maximum capacity?) as it ruins an otherwise glowing review of my dad's stay.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: humanitiesfh89
title: Perfect Midwives
body:
My time in maternity has been absolutely brilliant. All the staff involved in my care have been perfect - really really helpful. I would particularly like to mention Suzanne who was just absolutely great.  
The maternity ward has been absolutely perfect. I was slightly worried when I was admitted about COVID - but I have been pleasantly reassured through the constant cleaning of the ward.  
Overall, I have had a great experience and I have no suggestions for improvement. Keep up the good work.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: inspirewm49
title: All good so far in maternity
body:
My maternity experience has been all good so far. All the staff here have been really lovely. The midwives are truly excellent - very kind, caring and attentive.  
The maternity ward itself is really lovely and exceptionally clean. I cannot think of any improvements in particular, except maybe there should be more bathroom facilities available. However, overall my experience has been great so far.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: warmfr98
title: Top class care
body:
The maternity department at Daisy Hill Hospital has been absolutely brilliant - it has been absolutely top class.  
The midwives involved in my care have all been excellent - really helpful and caring. I would particularly like to mention midwives Maeve and Grace who were truly excellent and really lovely.  
The ward itself seems good and my care has overall been super - I cannot think of anything that could make the experience any better.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Hley
title: Everything was explained
body: I had a coil fitted which isnâ€™t the best experience you want to have. However the three nurses were exceptionally caring and kind. They made the experience as comfortable as possible always asking if I was alright. They explained everything as it was happening

author: Ty Tansley
title: Professional staff & procedure
body: I was so anxious about this appointment, but the staff went really above and beyond to make me feel safe and at ease. Karen and Abby where very kind and took great steps to help me feel comfortable before and after the procedure, whilst also being extremely professional and providing an excellent service.

author: George 50
title: My continuing health issues
body: My story began in 2004 after suffering a massive heart attack, followed by a cardiac arrest 4 months later. My health has been deteriorating ever since suffering from various different ailments. I have had  many years of using this service I  cannot praise it enough. The provision of expert care and advice is second to none

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: pyxisbt34
title: Wisdom teeth removal
body: I was seen by a dentist called Alex and two lovely nurses called Jenny and another nurse, whose name I sadly can't remember. All three of them were so understanding, patient, caring and reassuring. They constantly helped to make my experience as best as it could be. I get very anxious with needles and they continually helped me to feel more at ease. I honestly can't fault anything to do with their service and want to say a massive thank you to the three of them!

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very rude GP!
body: The GP I have spoken to this afternoon was disgusting in the way he spoke to me. He was uncaring, no empathy or apologies and he even put the phone down on me with no reason and I wasn't abrupt with him. If he continues to be a doctor at this practice then he needs to learn communicating better towards people that are asking for his help. There was no need for his attitude at all today and I came off the phonecall non the wiser if he is actually going to help or will I be waiting another 3 months for a response?

title: Impossible to book an appointment
body: I have tried over 50 times, various times of the day over many days to book an appointment and all that happens is they auto answer and say 'sorry all our staff are busy taking calls'. No option to leave a message, no online option. Massive waste of time.

author: ConorCougar
title: Lawson practice experience.
body:
I found the staff I encountered to be unhelpful and rude. Very dismissive and seemingly didn't make any attempt to connect me to help that I needed.  
Doctors have very limited availability and from my experience the booking system is completely flawed is impossible to get consistent care via telephone or internet.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: This surgery needs a review
body:
3 appointments in past few weeks due to feeling unwell and i am yet to see a GP! what is the point of having 9 (yes 9) GPs when you cannot see one only a nurse! 

Booking system is a joke, you have have to call in the morning and good luck getting through, once you get through a nurse phone you back in a few hours to do an over the phone assessment then the nurse decides if you see her or not! You can only discuss one issue with the nurse, if you have more than one issue you have to book another appointment, because they are short staffed yet the car park is full and there aint many patients! I've had to pay private to have a home test from boots because cant even be offered a blood test!

In summary if you want a morning appointment its not going to happen, you want to see a doctor its not going to happen, you want to book an appointment its not going to happen...the surgery may as well save money, remove the doctors and have nurses only. 

Oh did i mention that my doctor has left the surgery and i am yet to be told who my new doctor is

Please sort yourselves out so us patients can see a doctor and relieve pressure on hospitals. We have being telling the issues for years pre-covid and its just getting worse and worse!!

title: Awful incompetence
body: My Son and I both joined here from a great surgery when we moved. Experienced months of incompetence, never getting appointments, belittling receptionist and an ancient system that is no use online.

title: Thanku for saveing my life for second time
body: I need to say thanku to all on F3 Lung ward wythenshawe hospital because this second lung surgery left side and right side both sides stapled on the inside right across I say this because I only trust withinshaw hospital not stepping hill I got a friend that day to bring me I new I had something wrong with me flat lung bleb popt again so I came straight to A@E chest drain in but before that xray I no every thing about lungs by now been there had to many Thorax s to be honest not many people would survive what iv had done in out in out hospital s lungs gon Down chest drain s in out in out no kidney so both lungs oparation s on missing kidney and the rest wrong with me to me feel s like been cursed to get bad luck hopefully now fingers crossed I won't thanks to withinshaw hospital f3 team who work as team happy clean hospital Excellent food well looked after bads changed all times floors clean best hospital iv ever been to I carnt go stepping hill only withinshaw hospital can do lung surgery s am still recovering finding it hard but still am just myself like every one else apart from I try get myself better faster some how some way no choice thanku nurse s doctor s surgeon s your all brilliant and I will miss you s because your good at your jobs and happy you don't see this in stepping hill happy withinshaw you do that's good thing thanku for reading

author: apuspf76
title: Home support
body: My daughter was diagnosed with Anorexia Nervosa in March. Following a number of medical scares and very little restoration her consultant organised for intensive home support to be on board. My daughter has recently been discharged from the Camhs intensive home support team Lanarkshire. They have been involved in her treatment plan since April and their role was to provide daily support at home to prevent hospital admission. With their hard work and dedication, we were able to keep my daughter at home. The team members were Sandra, Evan, Simone, Peter and James. All these individuals are amazing and hard working who brought hope, laughter and positivity during the toughest days. Her named nurse was Evan who worked hard to help keep her at home and to support her recovery. He was amazing with her and was able to get her through some really distressing periods. As a family we cannot say thank you enough to this team they really have saved her life and we have our daughter back.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Impossible
body: Can never get through on phone in stacking queue which cuts out after 14 minutes. To register for online service 3 pieces of information required. Account ID Account linkage pass phrase and Organisation code  no guidance on where to find this information. Poor poor service.

title: Rude and unhelpful
body: It is not the first time I have been into this practice which is my local practice and the receptionists are short with their attitude unhelpful and rude prescriptions are rarely ready on time even when you give them the 3 to 4 days or it might just be me who knows! Today I arrived at 8:40 in the morning to find the dispensary closed I walked back round to the reception to ask what time it opens and the receptionist replied 8:30 I informed her it was shut and her response was thereâ€™s nothing I can do about it Iâ€™m on reception.. helpful as ever and I have heard a number of people mention over this coronavirus period how cruel they have been towards people that are mask exempt.

author: RachL21
title: Recent hospital stay
body: Iâ€™ve recently had a stay in hospital due to having surgery. I just wanted to say the biggest thank you ever to all staff, they really are superheroes in disguise! ! My surgeon Mr Ramsey, the staff on ward 206 and the stoma nurse team - they are amazing! After going into hospital absolutely terrified, I was immediately put at ease and was in the best care. The staff go above and beyond, I will never be able to thank them all enough!

title: Covid care
body: Making patients wait outside because of Covid is daft at best. What if there is bad weather? Are you going to go and find them sitting in their car? Staff entering and moving about public areas without a mask on makes the wait outside policy a lot worse than daft. I was here last year as a patient and then I saw quite a few members of staff NOT wearing masks. You need to get your act together.

title: Fair review
body: This practice helps when the patient is desperate and in need, that is good. I have been in situations with this practice where I am in desperate need and helped and not in urgent need but wanting help and not getting it. Overall, I am glad of the experience. The doctors are brilliant, they listen well.

title: Rude admin staff and incompetent practice
body: I rarely have cause to contact the surgery other than for my medication however needed to request that they update my Covid vaccination details as they have failed to record my vaccine from January some 8 months ago so I am unable to access my Covid passport. On Monday I was reassured that the practice manager was going to do this in time for my holiday at the end of the week and it could take up to 48 hours to register on the NHS app. However on Thursday this is still not completed, receptionist took 47 minutes to answer my call which was already a call back based on a so called new system where you retain your position in the queue as allegedly there is only 1 member of staff dealing with walk in's and all telephone calls. She was then very curt and not interested that the actions as stated by themselves on Monday had not been completed. I requested a call back from the practice manager but simply got a call back from another administrator who again failed to see the issue and blamed me for the fact they haven't registered by vaccine "because you didnt complete a form". When seeking clarity about what actions had been taken I was repeatedly told that it was in hand but its down to another agency who they have been unable to get hold of. Why cant people accept responsibility for their failures, apologise and act to rectify it rather than blaming everyone else. If this surgery is currently unable to cope with the limited numbers of people in our village how on earth is any extension of the practice going to work when we have 1600 new homes built and no additional GP practice. I have never met such rude administrators and I am simply appalled at their responses to this very simple request that should have been undertaken 8 months ago.

title: Longfield
body: I have been trying to book to see a doctor for several weeks. After getting through to the receptionist after a long wait I was informed no doctors were available and to ring at 8 pm in the morning. I asked could I book an appointment but was informed that this is not current policy. I am being treated for a medical condition that is not improving. I am concerned

author: septembertc99
title: I found it hard to understand
body:
I was inspected by two nurses all went good with them, because they both explained what they were going and why, and I understood.  
However when I went to see the Doctor it was very hard to understand what they were talking about. When they were using the instruments it was not nice. At the end I did not understand what I was being told but I could only understand and I would be back in 4 months.

author: Harsbars
title: I was given first-class treatment
body:
I was admitted to the hospital for green laser treatment. I was made to feel at ease as soon as I was in the ward by staff nurse Stephanie and her team and I would like to give a special mention to the anesthetist. I was given first class treatment and they informed me of everything that I was going through. After my operation I could not have been looked after any better. I cannot thank the staff at Queen Margaret Hospital enough I was discharged with everything that I needed to help with my recovery.  
Thanks Again.

title: Very poor. CQC complaint in process
body:
Offered appointment in November - 7 weeks hence! Had to seek treatment today from 111 clinician instead. 
Yes, they are in chaos, receptionists are rude but the issue is that they are not fit for purpose. We have no other option in the catchment area which is the heart of the problem. As a nurse, I find a reliance on 111 and walk in centres unacceptable but this really is what one has to do in absence of service from Marlborough surgery. My review is genuine and so many other Marlborough residents are becoming frustrated by the lack of service in the area. If you are eligible to register elsewhere, do so. If you experience poor service, contact CQC or the CCG - only by confronting this will things improve. Your complaint will help others and it is a serious situation. Marlborough surgery is failing residents and regulatory pressure, holding them to account, will make things better for us all

author: campbelli765
title: Acute urinary retention
body: Had a digestive complaint that caused bloating for a few hours if I ate or certain items, only this time I could no pass anything at all and had a catheter fitted for a month. Catheter removed painfully but failed, a new catheter fitted when bag emptying and stood up it felt like peeing broken glass. When a doctor appeared he suggested surgery, I was surprised as I had no tests and had no symptoms of prostate problems a few hours before catheterisation he then did a digital rectal exam which was ok if slightly enlarged, another then said my prostrate could have enlarged internally.I then ended up in the RAH neurological ward for another problem. When my catheter was blocked for two days I was left in pain for hours and I felt ignored. On the third day, my catheter was removed painfully but could pass after about 4mins but could later only pass some blood. At no time was a scan or given antibiotics or was I aware of a urine test, as it had been cloudy with sediment at the bottom. I am awaiting a reply from my GP, other that I do not know how to proceed.

author: Lesley T
title: Really listened to us and our son
body: My son suffered a crush injury to his finger after school so we took him to Stirling Community Hospital out of hours service. We were seen quickly and his care with Charlie (the nurse) and Carol (in X-ray) was absolutely outstanding. Our son is autistic and Charlie was so incredibly gentle, caring, kind and patient. He explained everything he was doing and really listened to us and our son, and adapted to our sons needs. In the X-ray department we had a great experience too. We are beyond grateful that the staff understood and responded to our sons needs. What a fabulous team. Thank you so much. It really meant the world.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Treating everyone the same needs to be reviewed
body:
My daughter is 17 and the lack of respect and dignity she received from the staff was appalling. The reception staff need to realise they are health care dealing with people who are worried about their health . Strongly recommend the basics are re looked at (6câ€™s)
If you do not want to show care and compassion basically you are in the wrong job!  38 years I have been with the surgery and now Iâ€™m going to leave because these two weeks talking to the reception staff have been awful ! Also Iâ€™m sure some data protection needs to be complete when talking about medical records when you call back ???? Maybe the etiquette of introducing yourself on a call should also be implemented. 
Disappointed service .

author: BettyP
title: More signage please in radiology
body:
I needed an xray and was advised to go to the xray department. I followed signs, which then just stopped, so I asked a member of staff and they advised itâ€™s just sitting down here. I had to sit round the corner as busy and patiently waitedâ€¦ for AGES. I went to get a drink where I saw a lot little sign saying â€™have you checked in at receptionâ€™? ðŸ™ˆ  
I would like to suggest that radiology reception sign shows xray / mri etc as I did not connect these terms so didnâ€™t think it was relevant to me (it wasnâ€™t mentioned I needed to visit a reception desk either at minor injuries which didnâ€™t help).  
Please more sign posting at each point!

author: spanishsun
title: Worth their weight in gold
body:
I had a stroke and staff from the Community Stroke Team came to see me - Esther, Jeffrey, Margaret and Roanne.
It goes without saying - they were all bloody marvellous.

My partner says that they helped her too, talking to her and explaining things

They've been worth their weight in gold and we could not have asked for better treatment.

We will always be grateful.

author: februaryym47
title: Brilliant staff
body:
I came to Daisy Hill via ambulance following shortness of breath. The ambulance staff were all very good and took good care of me.  
I was then brought to the Emergency Department where I spent a good deal of time owing to the lack of beds. However, all the staff I encountered whilst here were all very good.  
Up on the female surgical ward it has also been good. The staff have all been brilliant and I have no complaints.  
My stay so far has been a good one and I have no suggestions for improvement - it would be a hard job to find anything better.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Don't expect them to answer the phone?
body: Over one hour at caller number one in the queue and still no one answering the phone at this surgery.

author: inspiresg88
title: A great wee hospital
body:
My time in Daisy Hill began with a five hour wait in A&E. It was a long wait but the staff were all great and I really cannot say anything about them - they really should all get stars!  
Up on the female surgical ward it has also been excellent - all the nurses up here are amazing - very kind and caring. All the staff are really working so very hard at the minute.  
I cannot think of any improvements which could be made to improve my stay - Daisy Hill Hospital really is a great wee hospital.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great Practise
body: In these difficult times, the staff and doctors are always keen and happy to help. Great service and lovely doctors.

title: Not for the elderly!
body:
Disgraceful service by the receptionists at this surgery - need training on how to speak to people.
Maybe the practice needs to spend some money & send them on a course for how to speak to patients   
No due care for the elderly!
In addition the practice has requested an 80 year old to find another surgery!

author: Toffeeman20
title: Shockingly under resourced
body: My daughter has been unfortunate enough to have been admitted twice to Ward 17 at Monklands Hospital. I found it to be shockingly under-resourced and the staff that we encountered had a poor attitude. She vomited in the patient toilet and was handed cleaning wipes by a staff member to clean up after herself - when she was very ill. Weâ€™ve lost count of the number of times my daughter had to use her buzzer or had to wait on a registered nurse for meds, but waited forever! Yet we frequently saw staff congregating around the nursing station rather than actually spending time with sick patients. But I feel this has to come from the top down. It makes me wonder what the management are like if this is what the staff on the ward are like! My daughter will never be transferred to that ward again - a nightmare, and in my opinion dangerous.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Emmrd63
title: Advocacy
body: I worked with Becky last year and it was a pleasure to work with her on what was and still is a complex case and I'm so is pleased advocacy is still involved.

title: Rude receptionist
body: I have anxiety and brought my brother along to sit with me when I checked in, the lady was so rude asking if I go to work on my own with anxiety and my answer is no but she was so patronising and disrespectful the way she said it I never felt more embarrassed in my life I will never use this hospital again

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Bad Service
body: Our family registered to this surgery when we moved into the area earlier this year. My husband and I have now left as we found their service horrendous. It is constantly difficult to obtain a nurse or doctorâ€™s appointment and there was once where they told me because they only had 1 doctor on duty. When I had a consultation with regards to my baby daughter on a Friday early afternoon (whom unfortunately is still registered to the surgery), the doctor told us to go A&E instead because they wonâ€™t be able to see her that day. Sheâ€™s not even seriously ill to warrant a visit to A&E! I can never seem to obtain a doctorâ€™s appointment even for my baby daughter. Itâ€™s ridiculous...

author: Isla123
title: Unplanned Home Birth
body:
At the beginning of September I woke up with some bladder pain. 90 minutes later I asked my partner to phone Aberdeen Maternity Hospital to say that although labour had only just started I was coming in for pain relief. The midwife could hear me in the background and based on that alone correctly deduced I was about to give birth right there in my bathroom.  
My partner phoned 999 and while on the call my baby arrived. Around 20 minutes later the paramedics appeared for their first job of the day. I have contacted the Scottish Ambulance Service directly to convey my appreciation for the paramedicsâ€™ sensitivity and patience as I was in such a vulnerable condition. Myself and baby then made the ambulance trip into hospital for checks.  
The midwives and all staff I met during my brief hospital stay were so supportive and it meant so much for them to acknowledge that Iâ€™d been through a very speedy and unusual labour. They were also so intuitive about what kind of person I am, and having established that my baby and I were in good health we were left to relax and cuddle in peace which was just what we needed after a hectic but brilliant morning.

title: Very efficient service
body: I used the 'Engage Consult' facility today after being advised by 111 Online to contact my GP that same day. Within 2 hours I had a consultation with the duty GP and was requested to come straight up the the surgery for a face to face review. All the staff I had contact with were helpful and polite. My problem was dealt with efficiently and I came away feeling reassured.

title: Outstanding care
body:
I had an appointment with the Dr today & cannot speak highly enough of the service that this practice provides. The Dr listened attentively to my concerns & implemented a comprehensive care plan, to ensure that my issue is investigated thoroughly & treated fully. 

All staff at Priory Surgery treat me with respect & compassion & put me at ease whenever I'm in their care. No one likes a blood test, but the nurses are so gentle & engaging that I hardly notice it's being done. 

Whenever I've spoken to reception, they have always done their best to help me as much as possible & are always polite & good humoured.

Thank you so much to everyone there. I am confident that you are committed to, & successfully providing the best of what the NHS offers, for which I am truly grateful.

author: Ty's mum
title: Alcohol and me
body:
A few years ago, I came to the realisation that I had a drinking problem. At first it was a non issue, but things soon got out of control. I spoke to my GP who then referred me to One Recovery Bucks. Initially, I didn't think I need to go to such extreme. I was ashamed, I also felt like I wasn't the type of person who would need that kind of help. But I let go of my pride and booked an appointment. Even when I attended the induction, the shame overwhelmed me. I was assigned to a wonderful lady called Helen and she made me feel at ease straight away. She was non judgemental and I felt safe to really express my struggles. It was difficult at first to follow the plan she made for me, but her support motivated me.  
I was doing so well that they passed me over to another keyworker called Rob, who has been such a big part in my recovery journey. He has been such a huge support and i am forever grateful for his help.

title: Very efficient
body:
Friendly and professional staff who took care and attention when dealing with the problem. 
Fast, efficient and the minimum of fuss.

title: Awful service
body: I was referred by my dentist twice regarding a problem I have been dealing with for quite some time which required 6 visits to my dentist alone. I was rejected twice by leeds dental institute despite meeting the criteria and providing the additional information required. When I called and spoke to someone at this department he was incredibly rude and stated you donâ€™t meet the criteria. The attitude was incredibly rude and aggressive. I would not recommend this place to anyone. The attitude is unbelievable, offhandish and unfriendly. Not a place you want to have any dealings with

title: A pleasant experience
body: I had elbow surgery, from when I arrived in the morning until I left in the evening nothing was too much trouble everyone was wonderful and so helpful with the little things I could not manage at that stage I could not have been in better hands, thank you all very much.

title: Bad practice
body: I have been trying to get proof of previous medical history but was told they do not have any even though I have been a patient at the GP for more than 2 years. On top of the they didnâ€™t have access to any records stating they were not send over from my previous GP. Why did it take me asking them to realise that they did not have my records. Receptionist are very rude and make you feel insignificant and that you are getting in their way when it is their job as they are the first line of contact. I have never gotten an appointment from there at all. They seriously need to retrain their staff and change how the whole GP is ran because it is really unacceptable that you are being denied basic rights. The amount of bad reviews I have come across regarding this GP is out of this world and something should be done, because it seems to me as though there are thousands of patients that are suffering from the same malpractice.

author: scout25hmc
title: Autism Diagnostic & Intervention Services
body:
Autism Diagnostic & Intervention Services [ADIS - Clinical Team]  
My son has been awaiting an appointment with the ADIS. Due to COVID19 appointments understandably have been delayed further and service delivery changed from face-2-face appointments to zoom appointments. I was particularly nervous about how a zoom appointment was going to work but the Team contacted me beforehand to explained how the call would be undertaken and telephoned when they had made their decision and explained what would happen in the future.  
I am indebted for the care, attention, patience, openness and kindness of Shannan and Chloe for the advice, support and reassurance to both my son and myself.  
You do an amazing job ladies - keep doing what you do best! ! !  
With thanks

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: branxt36
title: To thank sexual health nurse who went above and beyond
body:
I was contacted by nurse who was allocating appointments to those on waiting list for Merina coil insertion, at the end of July.  
I no longer needed coil and when I asked if there was menopause clinic, she said there wasnâ€™t but went to ask one of the GPs within the service that day for some advice when I told her my symptoms.  
I am an NHS nurse of 30yrs and was so delighted that most of us would still go above and beyond to help our patientsâ€¦ Unfortunately I didn't get the nurse's name, but thank you for caring and you made me smile!  
Great attitude, great service from someone who was pleasant and who cared!

title: Superb!
body: Appointment for 1030am. Straight in. Administration done immediately. Put at ease by a welcoming nurse. Very short wait until surgery. All checks done then re-done. Explained to me what was going to happen. I was kept informed throughout the surgery. No pain whatsoever, despite having both eyes done one after the other. Treated with the utmost care that Royalty would have been proud of. Delighted to have the operation performed by the Consultant, who was excellent, as were all of her team. Scrupulously hygienic. No time wasting at all. In, done, out! Felt better next morning, and the results are stupendous. I am so grateful and indebted to the hospital, and so pleased that Frimley Park is our closest hospital to home. Forever thankful for our wonderful NHS and their excellent staff.

title: A caring practice
body: Not only does Hindon Surgery really care for its patients, it is both highly proactive and quickly responsive to patient needs.  In my experience of several consultations over recent years, appointments have been quickly arranged (within a day or so at the most), medical staff have been really thorough and professional, and the administrative staff friendly and efficient.  Specialist referals are quickly made and there is always prompt GP follow up.  This practice provides a first rate service that the local community is most fortunate to benefit from.

title: Children's A&E excellent
body: I had to take my son to Whipps pediatric a&e on Monday morning and I'm so impressed with the care we recieved. We arrived at 8am during the handover between night and day staff. The staff could see how unwell my child was and came and assessed him straight away. He was quickly seen by a doctor and started to receive treatment. Every member of staff who looked after him was excellent. They were so caring in what was a worrying time for us. Unfortunately there were no beds for us to stay at Whipps so we were transferred to another hospital. I'd like to thank all the staff for their dedication and care in what are challenging circumstances.

title: Children's ward
body: My son was transfered to Royal London from Whipps after falling unwell. We arrived late on Monday evening and the staff were expecting us. They welcomed us, made sure we were settled in our room, fed and had everything we needed. The room was big which was perfect for a 3 year old and the ward was very child friendly. The staff were amazing during our 2 day stay and they were very caring. There was a children's play room and playworker which was much needed for an active 3 year old and very tired parents. We would like to thank all the staff on ward 7D for your amazing care of our child, and us, in what was a very worrying time. Thank you!

title: Excellent triage followed by consultation
body: Initially advised by telephone. Online request made a.m. followed by phone call mid p.m. Appointment made during phone call. Visit to surgery felt safe. Doctor very thorough and explained problem clearly along with diagnosis and  prescription request created online. Collected later same day.

title: Respiratory team are amazing.
body:
Would like to say a big thank you to all the staff on the respiratory team. The secretaries drs and nurses show they care and I feel like I am being well looked after at a time when I wanted to give up.
Knowing I'm in good hands made me want to fight harder just by having a team that care about their patients. 
Thank you for all your support, care and kindness and for all what you are doing not just for me but others too. 
Thank you

title: Staff do their utmost best
body: I have seen many people complain about lakeside but I have to say they have never been a problem. My mum has terminal lung cancer and they have always responded promptly and with compassion. Cannot fault the service and I am extremely grateful for your care and support.  Thank-you so much

title: Excellent care
body:
I would like to thank the staff of Ward 12 for caring for my sister over the last few weeks. She canâ€™t speak highly enough of the whole team, who have made her feel valued and well cared for at a time she has felt most vulnerable. 
This has to be a great reflection on the Ward Manager, please pass on our thanks to him personally, for him to share with his team.

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Treatment for pains in my right foot
body: Thanks very much to the Nurse Practitioner who carried out a telephone interview with me this morning, Thursday 9 September. His advice regarding treatment for my foot, was clear and concise, and when acted upon, proved to be highly effective.

title: They have treated me well
body: They have treated me well and are very friendly people. They are very quick and if you ask questions they give you answers.

title: Great
body: First time I come for a blood test and it didn't hurt nor did I feel lightheaded after. The nurse on duty was amazing.

title: Excellent
body: Very happy with my treatment and the finished results, both my cataracts removed and much better vision with little discomfort,

title: Kind and very professional
body: I had an endometrial biopsy at gateway F today. The practitioner who carried out my procedure listened to my worries, reassured me and provided very professional and compassionate care. I was so nervous beforehand but was convinced Iâ€™d be looked after. A very positive experience for which Iâ€™m very grateful.

title: Caring Doctors and Receptionists
body: The receptionists are really friendly and efficient. The main Practice Doctor is really good. She is really caring and actually listens to you and refers you when needed. Highly recommend this doctors. 5 star service!!

title: Local practice
body: Well organised, speedy and very friendly- from arrival to exit including treatment was less than 10 minutes!!! Only had injection in knee but still very surprising. Thanks for a great experience!

title: MINOR SURGERY
body:
Warm welcome at reception- on 09/09/21 1320hrs  - also welcomed by practitioner and nurse 
surgery room gaining my confidence-knowledgeable well trained/equipped  staff put at ease efficient/ effective staff kept me informed - painless actioned surgery from practitioner and nurse keeping me informed at all times-  very good outcome completed - advised fully of aftercare and pain relief (of which I have had none) also given information leaflet clarifying all above - a very pleasant experience 11/10 - well done all concerned  Thank You very much for your help and assistance.

title: Life saver
body:
A big thanks to the exceptional diagnostic abilities at KGS without which I might not be here, also to the efficient and caring nursing staff who looked after me.
Having attended A&E for extreme chest pain and breathing difficulties I was seen quickly and an initial diagnosis of pneumonia made. X-Rays confirmed this and I was immediately put on a drip, however the doctor wished to take it further and I was then seen by a consultant who identified a pulmonary embolism. I was immediately sent for a CT scan which confirmed the diagnosis and I was admitted with immediate blood thinners and antibiotics.
Without the exceptional diagnostic ability of the doctor and consultants the outcome could have been very different.
I was looked after very well on the MAU and am now home and recovering. So, a big thanks to ALL.

readBy.name: Kettering General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: Fab service as usual medical issued dealt with efficiently by great staff. Receptionists are polite and friendly and doctors the same

title: terrific experience
body:
All the staff made it feel like a very covid safe experience. Everyone made me feel very comfortable and at ease. Waiting time was minimal and the procedure itself was over in less than 15 minutes. I had surgery on both eyes just over a month apart and had no problems what so ever.
SpaMedica were both friendly and professional and I am so glad I had the prs done.

title: Excellent service
body:
Over the past Month I have needed to complete numerous eConsults - each time the issues have been dealt with promptly and appropriately - this has been both administrative help and for medical need - I have quickly received the appropriate help (either a call back or face to face appointment with a GP or my admin request being replied to).
In these challenging times, with GP surgeries being overwhelmed with requests I am both amazed and  grateful how each 
Doctor manages to make me feel that they have time and are truely listening.
There are occasional â€˜hiccupsâ€™ with any surgery, but I cannot fault HEMC for their care, support and professionalism and can only applaud the actions they have taken to maintain their service to the community  despite the current challenges and restrictions

title: Very Prompt and Efficient
body: Phoned to book routine blood pressure test.  Answered quickly and dealt with in friendly and efficient way.

title: No answer
body: On the phone for over half an hour for a child with a big head bump. Gave up waiting. Shocking

title: Amazing treatment
body: As a new student in Liverpool without registering to a local GP, when I fell ill I had no idea what to do or how to fix the problem. However, upon calling Old Swan at around 9am, theyâ€™d booked me an appointment to see them at 12 and by 1pm I left with a prescription. The staff were extremely comforting and made me feel at ease, which is especially important to me as I get nervous about going to the doctors in general, let alone in a completely new environment. They were friendly and took care of me very quickly and I could not have asked for a better experience. A big thank you to the staff!

title: Avoid
body: Spoke to quite a few staff at this practice quality of care is very poor no empathy very abrupt manner and can't even get prescriptions right not helpful at all

title: great inpatient stay
body:
was admitted as an informal patient to lakefield ward for a short stay. the doctor on the ward was great at helping me to identify the goals I set for the stay and work with me to achieve them. medications were monitored properly and main staff and nurses were on the ball at all times. they could use a couple more staff members to help bolster the crew but this didn't stop them from being kind and compassionate and extremely patient to focus on helping everyone that was in need of care on a day to day basis, thanks for helping me through a tough period and allowing me to identify my goals to get back home and be with friends and family.

5*

readBy.name: Cheshire and Wirral Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

title: Kind friendly staff
body:
Have had to visit eye clinic several times over the years and am always impressed by the kindness of all the staff Iâ€™ve had dealings with. Very competent and professional. They take time to explain things too . The only negative is the lack of ventilation in the building.Hard to understand why there is so little natural light in hospitals.

A big thanks to everyone I saw today.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Childrenâ€™s Physio Brilliant
body: Received a brilliant child centred service. The physio was so engaging- the outcome of the work very successful- getting my child on board and motivated to do the exercises at home made such a difference . Thank you

title: Have to wait hours for the receptionist to answerâ€¦
body: The phone triage service by the receptionists is totally appalling, when I phoned to try and make an appointment with a Doctor I was number 4 in the queue I waited 2 hours and 15 minutes and they didn't bother to answer the phone. I know resources are stretched, shortage of staff etc is causing major problems and delays but having to wait 2 hours and 15 minutes for a receptionist to answer is absolutely terrible and they don't care. I really can't believe it takes this length of time for a receptionist to get through the 3 calls before me. Serious improvements need to be made in the length of time it's taking receptionists to answer the phones or employ receptionists that will show care, compassion and empathy.

title: Great experience
body: Less waiting time and overall great experience in all aspects testing , consultation with Dr , clear instructions for line of treatment.

title: Great practice
body:
I've had to have a couple of appointments recently,  the first was for my son. I had a telephone appointment with the Dr who was very helpful and friendly,  I needed a referral done for my son,  the Dr did the referral that day for me, very pleased.
My second appointment was with the nurse,  I read the appointment time wrong so turned up hours early but the receptionist was very kind and managed to get my appointment changed so I didn't need to come back later. The staff are very kind and helpful,  very pleased with the surgery.  Thank you .

title: Considerate and thorough
body: The staff and doctors at the Fitzwilliam Hospital were very considerate and thorough with their tests for a condition I had suspected I had for some time. Their ultrasound was more detailed than one I had at a previous hospital which had failed to spot that my ovaries were polycystic. The endocrinologist at the Fitzwilliam was very helpful and he was able to start me on the medicine I needed to take in order to aid my weight loss (and prevent diabetes). As a self-paying patient, it was well worth the price to gain clarity on what has been going on with my health (with symptoms that had recently increased in severity) over the last few years.

title: A very good and reliable practice
body:
Recived fast and reliable service during some very distressing times the doctors and staff are always curtious and proffesional.
`reception staff although very busy are always polite and helpful this pracice has dramaticly improved and pulled itself out of its dark past and  would not hesitate to recommend them to anyone and have done so with resounding success.
I have been with this surgery for 16 years and notice the changes in the past not always to the better but now it stands above most and during this most difficult time their system is beyond reproach.

title: Hardworking and Compassionate people
body: I can't say enough about the staff's concern and friendliness. My father spent his final days in Layer Marney, and theÂ majority of the staffÂ are really friendly, hands onÂ and trustworthy. They kept us informed about what was going on and assured us that my father was in good hands. I can't say enough about how thoughtful, encouraging and professional they are.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent care
body:
The endoscopy unit is excellent.From the 1st screening appointment ,through all investigations and procedures I received exemplary  care ,delivered with skill - and kindness. I am very thankful to all the doctors ,nurses and others  who, despite having working through difficult covid times, and still working 7 days a week, remained  cheerful , professional 
 and patient -and made everything much better than anticipated!

title: Life saving
body: I was admitted by ambulance to A&E for seizures in the early hours caused as a side effect from pain medication. The care I was given was outstanding in A&E, Intensive Care, and then when I was moved to Maple Ward for observation. The care that the nursing staff gave to the other older ladies on Maple Ward was really touching to witness. Thank you to all you amazing NHS staff, I am so grateful xxxx

title: Thank you
body: An enormous thank you to all the brilliant staff who have looked after me during my chemo journey .... especially yesterday!! I had a really frightening reaction  to my medication and everyone was extremely professional, caring and so kind. I really can't thank you enough - you are ALL amazing!!!!
